title: Bug 3970 - UI needed to define the default line delimiters for new files
description: Bug 3970 - Windows workstations are used as X terminals and to run Eclipse since they are cheaper than Unix boxes. However, when a new file is created on Windows, it is not given Unix line delimiters, which is necessary since the end product is a Unix product. Therefore, a UI (Preference) should be provided by the Workbench to define the line delimiter for new files. The possible values for line delimiters should include Dos/Windows, Mac, Unix, and the default platform line delimiter. This UI should be consistent across all plugins to ensure that all new files have the same line delimiter.
OB: Currently, when a new file is created on a Windows workstation, it does not have Unix line delimiters.
EB: The new file created on a Windows workstation should have Unix line delimiters, as it is necessary for the end product which is a Unix product.
SR:
1. Open Eclipse on a Windows workstation.
2. Create a new file.
3. Check the line delimiters of the new file.
